cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles E-SE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly tracking west-northwest today, then turning northwest and north toward the northern Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana to MS/AL coast) with very slow forward speed thereafter.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast between southeast Louisiana and the Mississippi/Alabama border
cyclone._note: Storm never approaches Port Everglades’ shoreline – remains in the Gulf of Mexico.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Indian Pass FL to Ochlockonee River FL (Tropical Storm Watch); MS/AL border to AL/FL border (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City LA to MS/AL border (Hurricane Warning); MS/AL border to Indian Pass FL (Tropical Storm Warning); Port Fourchon LA to AL/FL border (Storm-Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through the western Florida Panhandle; inland AL/MS and parts of the Southeast later in the week
weather_observation.wind: Brief gusty squalls possible in outer rain-bands, but sustained gale-force winds are unlikely at Port Everglades (≤ 5% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the southeast Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands may bring 1–3 inches of rain; localized downpours could cause minor ponding on terminals.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rip currents and rough surf along Atlantic beaches; occasional lightning in squall lines.
